org.jlinalg.optimise

Interface Target<RE extends IRingElement<RE>>

  • Type Parameters:
    RE - The type of the residual.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Function

    public interface Target<RE extends IRingElement<RE>>
    This interface is to be used in combination with Optimiser. It is the contract to be fulfilled by a class that is to be optimised. This is the interface the optimiser will use. The target has to provide access to a set of minimum and maximum values for set of parameters. The parameters can be mixed, as long as getParameters()[i], maxParameterValues()[i], and minParameterValues()[i] are of the same type.
    Author:
    Georg Thimm 2009

    • Method Detail

      • getResidual

        RE getResidual()
        Give access to the residual for the parameters as they are stored in the target object.
        Returns:
        the residual for the state of the target object or null if the parameters are not a valid state for the target.

      • getParameters

        IRingElement<?>[] getParameters()
        Returns:
        the parameters as they are stored in the target.

      • setParameters

        void setParameters(IRingElement<?>[] values)
        Change the parameters
        Parameters:
        values - the new value

      • setParameter

        boolean setParameter(int index,
                     IRingElement<?> value)
        Change one parameter
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the new parameter.
        value - the new value of a parameter
        Returns:
        true if value is in the range specified by maxParameterValues()[index] and minParameterValues()[index]

      • minParameterValues

        IRingElement<?>[] minParameterValues()
        Returns:
        the minimum permissible values for the parameters. This may be null (no lower limit is then used), or individual elements may be null (and then for this element no lower limit exists).

      • maxParameterValues

        IRingElement<?>[] maxParameterValues()
        Returns:
        the maximum permissible values for the parameters. This may be null (no upper limit is then used), or individual elements may be null (and then for this element no upper limit exists).

      • getParameter

        IRingElement<?> getParameter(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - the number of the parameter
        Returns:
        a parameter
